title: Manchester United's senior players 'unconvinced' by coach Kieran McKenna
text:
A number of Manchester United's senior players are reportedly 'unconvinced' by first team coach Kieran McKenna after the club's dreadful start to the season.

McKenna has taken charge of training sessions since Ole Gunnar Solskjaer was given the managerial job.

And according to the Metro, some established first team stars 'feel unprepared' for matches under the Northern Irishman, a claim supported by Sportsmail's original story.

Kieran McKenna (left) has increased responsibility under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer (right)

There is discontent among the group, particularly in the attacking department with United struggling desperately to score goals.

After joining the club from Tottenham under Jose Mourinho, 33-year-old McKenna rose through the ranks after impressing with the academy.

He therefore has a strong relationship with a number of young players but senior figures in the dressing room remain skeptical of his abilities.

Having scored just once in their last four matches, the lack of cutting edge is becoming a real problem for Solskjaer's men, who are currently 12th in the Premier League.

McKenna has risen quickly through the ranks but some are dubious about his abilities

United are languishing down in 12th in the Premier League after eight games this season

Certain members of the squad feel McKenna and the coaching staff have not worked enough on creating new patterns and options for play in the final third.

Solskjaer's job remains safe for the time being with his plan for the club remaining a long term project.

But if the current poor form continues then the resolve of United's boardroom, in particular Ed Woodward, will be severely tested.
description: A number of Manchester United's senior players are reportedly 'unconvinced' by first team coach Kieran McKenna after the club's dreadful start to the season.
